0.title: 4-storey building collapses in Mumbai's Borivali West; video surfaces
0.article_body: A four-storey building collapsed in Saibaba Nagar of Borivali West in Mumbai on Friday, Fire brigade officials said. A video of the building collapsing has surfaced online. At least eight fire engines and fire brigade personnel rushed to the spot, BMC said. Earlier this month, a portion of a five-storey residential building in Thane city's Daighar area collapsed.

1.title: He wanted to 'protect' himself: Sivaramakrishnan on Kuldeep's 0/36
1.article_body: Discussing Kuldeep Yadav's spell in the first ODI against Zimbabwe, where he conceded 36 runs without picking a wicket, ex-India leg-spinner Laxman Sivaramakrishnan said Kuldeep wanted to "protect" himself. "MS Dhoni would advice Kuldeep...on what to bowl...But today, the situation was different," added Sivaramakrishnan. "Kuldeep was making a comeback...He wanted to play all...games," he stated.

2.title: Parts of Gurugram to get no water for 24 hrs on Aug 22, list of areas shared
2.article_body: Water supply will be affected in parts of Gurugram for 24 hours from August 22 to August 23 because of master water supply pipeline from the Basai water treatment plant being shut due to construction work. Supply will be affected in sectors 4, 5, 9, 12, 14, 17, 18, 21, 22, Palam Vihar and Dayanand colony, a notice said.

3.title: Ex-Sri Lankan President Gotabaya applies for US Green Card: Reports
3.article_body: Ex-Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa, who recently fled the country, has applied for a US Green Card, reports said. His lawyers have started the procedure to obtain the Green Card, stating Rajapaksa's wife Loma being a US citizen as the factor which makes him eligible for it, reports added. Rajapaksa in 2019 renounced his US citizenship to contest Presidential elections.

4.title: Mother, lover beat minor son, burn him with hot sieve in Gurugram
4.article_body: A woman and her lover were arrested for allegedly beating her 13-year-old son and burning his face and feet with a hot sieve after he saw them in an objectionable position in Gurugram, police said on Thursday. The woman's lover also apparently threatened to chop the boy's legs when the latter threatened to complain. The boy, however, managed to escape.

5.title: Traffic diversions to be in place today in Pune for Dahi Handi
5.article_body: The Pune City Traffic Police has announced that traffic diversions will be in place in parts of the city from 5 pm today as festivities for Dahi Handi are expected to attract large crowds. The traffic police said that the diversions will be in place until the 'handis' or earthen pots are broken and the roads are cleared for traffic.

6.title: Govt shares map, says 'IITs reaching students in every corner of India'
6.article_body: The Centre has shared a picture of the map of India, showing the presence of IITs in as many as 21 states and two union territories. "Indian Institute of Technology (IITs) reaching students in every corner of India," the Centre tweeted. It also stated that eight of the IITs were established in the last decade.

7.title: 15 prisoners get death sentence for killing inmate in Jharkhand
7.article_body: A court in Jharkhand's East Singhbhum district has handed death sentence to 15 prisoners for killing a fellow inmate at the Ghaghidih Central Jail in 2019. Seven others have been sentenced to 10 years in jail. The killing occurred following a clash between two factions of prisoners over breaking a queue at the jail's telephone booth.

8.title: Be careful while signing official documents: Mamata to WB ministers
8.article_body: While addressing a meeting, West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Thursday told all of the state ministers to be "very careful" while signing official documents, a senior official said. This comes after the arrests of former state minister Partha Chatterjee and TMC leader Anubrata Mondal in separate alleged scams. "You (ministers) should all maintain a simple life," Banerjee said.

9.title: Pune reports rise in swine flu cases; vaccines distributed to hospitals
9.article_body: Pune city has been witnessing a rise in swine flu cases with 435 positive cases and 20 deaths till August 16. Vaccine stock has been supplied to hospitals to ensure that high-risk patients don't face inconvenience, Health department officials said. As many as 3,785 samples were sent for testing this year and 435 patients tested positive, Pune Municipal Corporation added.

10.title: Arvind Kejriwal issues missed call number for 'Make India No. 1' mission
10.article_body: Delhi CM and Aam Aadmi Party chief Arvind Kejriwal on Friday launched a missed called number as part of the 'Make India No. 1' mission. "I am issuing a number today, missed call number 9510001000. Those who want to join this mission, those who want to see India as...the most powerful nation...should join this mission," Kejriwal said.

11.title: Two wickets down, one to go: Mishra after CBI raids Sisodia's residence
11.article_body: After CBI raided Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia's residence on Friday morning, BJP leader Kapil Mishra said "two wickets had fallen and the third will soon". "I've been saying...Satyendar Jain, Manish Sisodia and Arvind Kejriwal will all go to jail for corruption," Mishra tweeted. Earlier in May, Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain was arrested in an alleged money laundering case.

12.title: Pune woman leaves home to end life, police check hotels; locate, rescue her
12.article_body: The Pune city police located a woman who had allegedly left her house with an intention of ending her life. She was located after police checked several hotels and lodges in the city. The woman is a doctor and her husband had filed a missing complaint after she had left home. Reports said that she was reunited with her family.

13.title: J&K Waqf Board bans trustees from collecting donations at shrines
13.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir Waqf Board has banned trustees from collecting donations at shrines and mosques, calling it an "unethical practice". The decision on the ban was taken following complaints "against some people receiving donations forcibly and through exploitative means", according to the Board. The Board said that such acts of "pilferage" are "severely limiting" its ability to perform charity.

14.title: India's CWG lawn bowls champs break down, say 'People said we were selected due to looks'
14.article_body: The members of India's women's fours lawn bowls team, that won historic gold at CWG 2022, broke down during an interview recalling the criticism they faced in the build up to the Games. Lovely Choubey stated people told them that they were selected due to their looks. "Criticism that we faced cannot be expressed in words," said Rupa Rani Tirkey.

15.title: 21-yr-old woman gets 3 men to gang-rape 11-yr-old friend, watches it in Mumbai
15.article_body: An 11-year-old girl was gang-raped by three men in Mumbai's Virar. The girl had gone for a walk with a 21-year-old female friend, whom she met at a mobile repair shop. The female friend took the victim to an isolated spot and called three of her male friends. The victim's friend then watched the sexual assault.

16.title: 3 arrested for rhino horn smuggling in Assam
16.article_body: Three people have been arrested by the forest officials in Assam for their involvement in the smuggling of rhino horns near Kaziranga National Park. "One of the accused was caught from the Baghmari area. After his confession, two others were also nabbed," said District Forest Officer. Park officials found the dehorned rhino on May 9.

17.title: Video of KL Rahul removing chewing gum before National Anthem goes viral, fans react
17.article_body: A video has gone viral showing Team India captain KL Rahul removing chewing gum from his mouth ahead of the National Anthem before the start of the first ODI against Zimbabwe. "Proud of you," a fan wrote. "He is truly a gentleman," wrote another. Earlier, Virat Kohli was criticised for chewing gum during National Anthem in 2017 and January 2022.

18.title: PM Modi extends greetings to citizens on Janmashtami
18.article_body: On the occasion of Janmashtami, PM Modi greeted citizens and wished for everyone's prosperity. "Hearty greetings to all the countrymen on the auspicious occasion of Janmashtami. May this festival of devotion and gaiety bring happiness, prosperity and good fortune to everyone's life. Long live Shri Krishna!" tweeted PM. President Droupadi Murmu also extended greetings on the auspicious day.

19.title: Eatery owner stabs customer after dispute over biryani bill in UP
19.article_body: An eatery owner allegedly stabbed a customer following a dispute over biryani bill in Uttar Pradesh's Jalaun. According to police, the victim paid ₹50 to the owner for biryani but the latter denied having received the payment and demanded money again. This led to a brawl. The customer was hospitalised after getting stabbed multiple times, while the accused is absconding.

20.title: 2022 deadliest year on record for Mexican journalists: Report
20.article_body: Article 19, a human rights organisation, said in a report that 2022 has been the deadliest year on record for journalists in Mexico, with 18 murders. Nine of those deaths have showcased a potential link to the journalist's work, the organisation's regional director Leopoldo Maldonado said. Maldonado added, "2022 could be the worst year in a century for the press."

21.title: Domino's India parent stock gained 14% so far in Aug after Q1 results
21.article_body: Jubilant FoodWorks, parent company of Domino's Pizza India, fell over 3% on BSE at 11:50 am on Friday. However, it gained over 14% so far this month while witnessing an upward trend. The company reported a strong Q1 earnings with a 63% growth in consolidated profit at ₹112.6 crore and its consolidated revenue from operations was up by 40.5%.

22.title: Country's confidence and trust in BJP has grown: Rajnath Singh
22.article_body: Talking about BJP's pro-people ideology, Defence Minister Rajnath Singh claimed that country's confidence and trust in the party has grown. "The perception of the people about the BJP has changed. There has been a sense of trust and confidence across India towards the BJP. India's reputation has risen on the international level," said Singh.

23.title: Oil prices fall amid global economic slowdown concerns
23.article_body: After two days of gain, oil prices fell on Friday amid concerns about a global economic slowdown. Brent crude futures fell 36 cents to $96.23 a barrel, while the US West Texas Intermediate crude was at $90.29 a barrel, falling 21 cents. US crude oil inventories declined as US exported 5 million barrels per day in the most recent week.

24.title: What is the wait time for US visa appointment in different Indian cities?
24.article_body: The US has listed that people applying for visitor visa in Delhi will have to wait 582 days for an appointment while the wait time for student visa is 471 days. The wait time for visitor visa in Mumbai is 580 days. The waiting period for visitor visa in Kolkata, Hyderabad and Chennai is 587, 510 and 513 days, respectively.

25.title: Windfall profit tax on diesel export hiked, domestic crude tax cut
25.article_body: The government on Thursday increased the windfall profit tax on the export of diesel to ₹7 per litre from ₹5 per litre, Finance Ministry notification showed. It also brought back a ₹2 a litre tax on the export of aviation turbine fuel. The tax on domestically produced crude oil has been slashed from ₹17,750 per tonne to ₹13,000 per tonne.

26.title: It's Raj's misfortune that it doesn't have a full-time Home Minister: BJP
26.article_body: Rajasthan BJP chief Satish Poonia on Thursday said it is the state's misfortune that it doesn't have a full-time Home Minister for the last three-and-a-half years. He alleged that Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot, who also handles the home department, doesn't seem concerned about public safety. "For him, the security of his chair is bigger than people's security," Poonia added.

27.title: No competition from Karthik for a spot in T20Is: Chandu Borde on Pant
27.article_body: Ex-India all-rounder Chandu Borde said he doesn't think there is "any competition" for Rishabh Pant from Dinesh Karthik for a spot in T20Is. "Pant is not just a finisher, he can play anywhere...He is an automatic choice," added Borde. Former India all-rounder Irfan Pathan earlier selected Karthik over Pant while naming his lineup for T20 World Cup 2022.

28.title: Family said 'Didn't educate you for this': Anurag on decision to go into cinema
28.article_body: Filmmaker Anurag Kashyap, while talking about his decision to enter the cinema industry, said that his family was not supportive. "They were supportive of like, 'If you have decided, then go and try. But, we didn't educate you so much for this'. It was like, 'Let him try for 1-2 years...then he'll come back on his own'," he added.

29.title: Estonia hit by cyberattacks after removing Soviet-era monument
29.article_body: Estonia said it has repelled "the most extensive cyberattacks since 2007" shortly after removing a Soviet-era tank monument. Russian hacker group Killnet claimed responsibility for the attacks, saying it'd blocked access to over 200 state and private Estonian institutions. Estonia's government on Tuesday ordered the swift removal of all public Soviet memorials, citing Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

30.title: Every inning is like a 'war' for him: Kaif on Shikhar Dhawan's 81*
30.article_body: Former India cricketer Mohammad Kaif said every inning is like a "war" for Shikhar Dhawan, who scored an unbeaten 81 in the first ODI against Zimbabwe, which India won by 10 wickets. "Dhawan...plays ODIs only...If he does badly, then he'll be out from here as well," added Kaif. "He did not have a good ODI tour of England," stated Kaif.

31.title: K'taka woman elopes with lover in Saudi; man kills self, poisons 3 kids
31.article_body: A man in Karnataka's Tumakuru died after he allegedly consumed poison after his wife eloped with her lover in Saudi Arabia, police said. He also poisoned their three children who are reportedly critical at a Bengaluru hospital. The wife allegedly made video calls to the man showing herself enjoying at different locations with her lover in Saudi, police added.

32.title: Bengal once centre of excellence, now seeing 'scams' in education: Pradhan
32.article_body: Union Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan on Thursday said West Bengal, which was once known as a centre of culture and excellence, is now being maligned due to scams. "Influential leaders of ruling party...involved in scams have minted money and...deserving...aspirants are on roads for over 500 days. Such things shouldn't be tolerated as Bengal was known for education," Pradhan added.

33.title: IAS officer reacts to Bilkis rape convicts' release, says 'I sit in disbelief as a woman'
33.article_body: After 11 convicts sentenced to life imprisonment for gangraping Bilkis Bano and killing her family members were released, IAS officer Smita Sabharwal tweeted, "As a woman and civil servant I sit in disbelief, on reading the news on the #BilkisBanoCase." "We cannot snuff out her Right to breathe free without fear, again and call ourselves a free nation," she added.

34.title: Social media influencer Bobby Kataria to be arrested for liquor stunt on road
34.article_body: Social media influencer Bobby Kataria will be arrested by Uttarakhand Police for drinking alcohol and threatening the police while sitting on a chair in the middle of the road and stopping traffic in Dehradun. Police has obtained a non-bailable warrant against Kataria from the district court, SHO Rajendra Singh Rawat said. Multiple teams are being sent for his arrest.

35.title: Over 6,000 signatories demand to reverse Bilkis Bano case convicts' release
35.article_body: Over 6,000 citizens, including historians, activists, women, grassroots workers and others have urged the Supreme Court to reverse the release of 11 men convicted of rape and murder in the 2002 Bilkis Bano case. "The remission of sentences for convicted...will have a chilling effect on every rape victim who is told to 'trust the system'...'have faith'," the signatories said.

36.title: AIMIM will contest municipal polls in UP, says party's state chief
36.article_body: All India Majlis-E-Ittehadul Muslimeen (AIMIM) will contest municipal elections across Uttar Pradesh, party's state unit chief Shaukat Ali Khan said on Thursday. "Soon we will announce candidates for Chairman, Panchayat Raj and other posts," he added. The party had fought the state election held earlier this year but failed to win any seat.

37.title: TV actress Kanishka Soni says she has married herself, posts pic with mangalsutra
37.article_body: TV actress Kanishka Soni has claimed that she has married herself while posting pictures of herself wearing a mangalsutra and sporting sindoor. "Married to myself since I fulfilled all my dreams my own & the only person I am in love with is MYSELF...I don't need any Man Ever," she wrote in her Instagram post.

38.title: Autorickshaw unions propose ₹6 fare hike for first 1.5 km in Pune
38.article_body: Autorickshaw unions have proposed a fare hike of ₹6 for the first 1.5 kilometres and ₹4 for every subsequent kilometre amid a surge in fuel and CNG prices in Pune. Earlier, Pune's Regional Transport Authority planned a ₹2 fare hike for the first 1.5 km, but it was put on hold after the unions said that the hike was less.

39.title: RRR is vile, a primitive feast of sadism: 'Bad Boy Billionaires...' maker
39.article_body: Filmmaker Dylan Mohan Gray, who directed an episode of docuseries 'Bad Boy Billionaires: India' termed 'RRR' "vile" as well as a "primitive feast of sadism" on Twitter. Talking about 'The Kashmir Files', Dylan tweeted, "It's (hate-mongering, revisionist) garbage of no artistic merit and will be a further embarrassment to India if 'selected' [as India's entry for the Oscars]."

40.title: India to meet same fate as Pak if BJP tries to turn it into 'Hindu Rashtra': Gehlot
40.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Thursday said that India would "meet the same fate as Pakistan if BJP tries to turn it into a 'Hindu Rashtra'". Terming BJP as "fascist", he claimed that it has no governance model and is winning elections "only on...issue of religion". "Politics based on religion is the easiest...even Adolf Hitler indulged in it," he added.

41.title: Lodha brings back the 'Apna Ghar, Apna Desh' campaign
41.article_body: Lodha has unveiled the latest film in the 'Apna Ghar, Apna Desh' campaign, shot in the backdrop of Lodha homes. The campaign aims to bring forth the essence of how moments of joy in every citizen's life result in the prosperity of the nation and captures heartfelt moments that echo the proud sentiment of nation building, shared Lodha.

42.title: Someone should remind Mbappé that Messi had 4 Ballon d'Ors at 22: Rooney
42.article_body: Ex-Manchester United player Wayne Rooney said he has "never seen a bigger ego" than that of Paris Saint-Germain forward Kylian Mbappé. "A 22-23 year old player throwing a shoulder at Lionel Messi...Someone remind Mbappé that Messi had four Ballon d'Ors...at 22," added Rooney. Mbappé was seen shoving Messi with his shoulder during a PSG match in a viral video.

43.title: 61 lakh passengers availed free bus rides on I-Day in B'luru: BMTC
43.article_body: About 61.47 lakh people availed free bus rides offered by Bengaluru Metropolitan Transport Corporation (BMTC) on August 15, BMTC said in a statement. "A total of 5,051 buses were operated," BMTC added. On the occasion of BMTC's 25 years of service in the city, passengers were allowed to travel free of cost in non-AC, electric and AC buses on Monday.

44.title: 2 people killed after 2 small planes collide mid-air in California
44.article_body: At least two people were killed after two small planes collided mid-air in California while trying to land at a local airport on Thursday, officials said. Two people were aboard a twin-engine Cessna 340 and one aboard a single-engine Cessna 152. Reportedly, one plane crashed into a hanger at the airport, while the other ended up in a nearby field.

45.title: US reacts as wait time crosses 500 days for visa appointments for Indians
45.article_body: The wait time of appointments for people applying for visitor visa to the US crossed over 500 days in Indian cities, according to the US State Department website. US embassy spokesperson said they are working on cutting waiting time through steps such as increasing consular staffing and prioritising certain visa types. The official attributed delays to the Covid-19 pandemic recovery.

46.title: Must thank God Godse was hanged: Owaisi on Bilkis Bano's rapists' release
46.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi, while speaking about the release of Bilkis Bano's rapists, said that it is the Bharatiya Janata Party's policy to stand by rapists. "Gang-rape & child murder are 'good sanskaar'...BJP is giving 'get out of jail free passes' on caste lines. We must thank God that at least Godse was convicted and hanged," he added.

47.title: 2 minor girls kidnapped in Ghaziabad; one found dead, other escapes
47.article_body: A 25-year-old man was arrested after he allegedly kidnapped two girls, aged six and nine, from a village in Ghaziabad. The elder girl was found dead in a field, while the other girl managed to escape, police said. According to preliminary investigation, police suspect that the accused, who was reportedly in an inebriated state, intended to sexually assault the girls.

48.title: Prisoner alleges Punjab jail admin wrote 'gangster' on back with hot iron
48.article_body: A prisoner in Punjab's Ferozepur alleged that the jail administration wrote 'gangster' in Punjabi on his back with a hot iron rod. A court directed the police to conduct the medical examination of the complainant and submit the report by August 20. The prisoner also claimed that plans to kill him in the jail itself were also being made.

49.title: 'Granthi' assaulted, urine splashed in his face in Punjab; 5 booked
49.article_body: Five people have been booked and two of them were arrested after a Sikh priest in Punjab's Malerkotla district was assaulted. The 'Granthi' at the gurdwara in Abdullapur Chuhane village, Hardev Singh, claimed that he was beaten by a few locals, his face was blackened and urine kept in a mug was splashed in his face.

50.title: DGPs in border states should keep watch on demographic changes: Amit Shah
50.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Thursday said all Director Generals of Police (DGPs) in border states should keep vigil on the demographic changes in their respective areas. He added that it was the DGPs' responsibility to gather all technical and strategic information in their states, especially in border districts. Shah was addressing the National Security Strategies (NSS) Conference 2022.

51.title: K'taka mandates singing National Anthem in schools, PU colleges
51.article_body: Karnataka government has issued an order making it compulsory for all schools and pre-university (PU) colleges to make students sing National Anthem every morning during mass prayer. This comes following complaints that some schools weren't doing so despite a government order. If there's a lack of space for mass prayer, National Anthem should be sung in classrooms, the order states.

52.title: Rushdie's attacker denied bail, judge bars lawyers from giving interviews
52.article_body: A US judge has refused to grant bail to Hadi Matar, a 24-year-old man accused of stabbing author Salman Rushdie. The judge also ordered lawyers involved in the case not to give interviews to press until the matter is resolved. Matar was arrested on August 12 after he stabbed Rushdie multiple times in front of a crowd in New York.

53.title: 3rd Vande Bharat train reaches Chandigarh for speed trials
53.article_body: Country's third Vande Bharat semi-high speed train has arrived in Chandigarh for a trial run, which is likely to start on August 24. It will be tested at speeds of 15 kmph, followed by 45, 60, 80 and 110 kmph. The second phase of the trial run will start on August 29 between Kota and Nagda railway station.

54.title: Thane man out to get village tickets for Ganeshotsav hit by MSRTC bus, dies
54.article_body: A 46-year-old man was killed after he was hit by a Maharashtra State Road Transport Corporation (MSRTC) in Thane. He had gone to reserve tickets to go to his village for Ganeshotsav festival. Reports said the bus driver did not see him cross the road and rammed into him. Police said the front wheel of bus ran over deceased's abdomen.

55.title: Morally wrong: 'The...' maker on Kashyap's 'Don't send it to Oscars' remark
55.article_body: Reacting to filmmaker Anurag Kashyap stating he hopes 'The Kashmir Files' isn't sent as India's entry for the Oscars, the film's director Vivek Agnihotri said, "It's...ethically and morally wrong." Agnihotri added that Kashyap had "problems" with the film in the past and even tried to "sabotage" it. "I make my film...passionately so I can protect it very passionately," he stated.

56.title: India reports 15,754 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 1,01,830
56.article_body: India has reported 15,754 COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 12,608 COVID-19 cases. Active cases in India stand at 1,01,830, while the death toll has risen to 5,27,253, according to the latest data.

57.title: Wall Street closes at a high after Cisco's upbeat sales forecast
57.article_body: US stocks closed at a high on Thursday after the technology sector was lifted by an upbeat sales forecast from Cisco Systems. Cisco's stock surged 5.8% and was one of the major positives on the indices. The Dow Jones Industrial Average rose to 33,999.04, the S&P 500 increased to 4,283.74 and the Nasdaq Composite surged to 12,965.34.

58.title: Market valuation of BSE-listed firms hits all-time high of ₹280.5 lakh crore
58.article_body: The total market capitalisation of BSE-listed companies touched an all-time high of ₹280.50 lakh crore supported by the recent consistent gains in domestic stocks. "Recent gains in Indian indices have been helped by a combination of factors including encouraging macro data, fall in commodity prices, slowing inflation," said Dhiraj Relli, MD and CEO at HDFC Securities.

59.title: Our wedding memes were shared in friends group, we used to have blast: Vicky
59.article_body: Actor Vicky Kaushal said that memes about his and actress Katrina Kaif's wedding used to be shared in a friends group. "We had a friends group and everyday...all these memes and funny tweets and funny messages would get shared and we would laugh about it...We used to have a blast," he added, while also talking about speculations about his wedding.

60.title: Pope rules out sex assault inquiry against Canada cardinal
60.article_body: Pope Francis has ruled out a formal church investigation into accusations of sexual misconduct against one of its top cardinals due to insufficient evidence, the Vatican said. Canadian Cardinal Marc Ouellet was named in a class-action lawsuit accusing some 88 clergy members of sexual assault in Quebec. The 78-year-old is accused of abusing a female intern between 2008 and 2010.

61.title: Sensex rises 50.21 points to open at 60,348, Nifty at 17,967
61.article_body: Benchmark indices opened flat on Friday with Sensex rising 50.21 points at 60,348.21 and Nifty at 17,967.30, up by 10.80 points. Eicher Motors, ONGC, M&M, Tech Mahindra and HDFC Life were among the major Nifty gainers, while the shares of BPCL, Power Grid Corp, Coal India, IndusInd Bank and Reliance Industries slipped. Nearly 1,365 shares advanced and 540 shares declined.

62.title: Frame charges within 3 months in Bhima-Koregaon case: SC to NIA court
62.article_body: Supreme Court on Thursday directed a National Investigation Agency (NIA) court to decide on framing charges in the 2018 Bhima-Koregaon case within three months. The court was hearing a petition filed by human rights activist Vernon Gonsalves seeking bail in the case. SC also asked NIA to separate Gonsalves' trial from other accused persons who are absconding in the case.

63.title: Muslim woman denied rental accommodations in Bengaluru; chats go viral
63.article_body: A Muslim woman searching for an accommodation in Bengaluru faced rejection by homeowners because of her religious beliefs. The woman, named Haifa, shared screenshots of her interactions on social media, which went viral. "Property is available but owner wants a Hindu family," a message in one of the screenshots read. "Here is how I spent my August 15th," she wrote.

64.title: B'luru's Electronic City residents protest against waste processing plant
64.article_body: Residents of Chikkanagamangala in Bengaluru's Electronic City held a protest on Wednesday seeking closure of a waste processing plant. The protesters complained about a foul smell and leachate emanating from the plant. They have demanded action from BBMP on the issue. "Residents and cattle are falling sick due to polluted air and contaminated water," said a protester.

65.title: CBI raiding 21 locations in Delhi in connection with excise policy case; CM says 'Welcome'
65.article_body: CBI is raiding 21 locations in Delhi in connection with the excise policy case, including the residence of Deputy CM Manish Sisodia. "Welcome CBI," CM Arvind Kejriwal tweeted. "The day on which Delhi's education model was praised...Sisodia's picture was printed on the front page of The New York Times...the same day the Centre sent CBI to his house," Kejriwal added.

66.title: Who took decision, if not Centre: Sisodia on Rohingyas resettlement in Delhi
66.article_body: Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia wrote to Union Home Minister Amit Shah over the issue of resettlement of Rohingyas in Delhi.  He also held a press conference on Thursday. "Who took the decision on the resettlement of the Rohingyas in Delhi's EWS flats if it was not the Centre...the Delhi government had no involvement in this," Sisodia said.

67.title: I followed 'Fatka', his mom thought I was child snatcher: Mukesh on 'Chillar..'
67.article_body: Casting Director Mukesh Chhabra recalled an incident involving one of the child actors from the movie 'Chillar Party'. "I spotted him [kid who plays Fatka] at Lokhandwala red light...I followed him home. His mother thought I'm a child snatcher. I said, 'No, a film is being made about kids. I'm casting for it'. She could not believe me," he added.

68.title: I feel that I am a 'besura': Singer Lucky Ali
68.article_body: Singer Lucky Ali, who has sung songs like 'Ek Pal Ka Jeena' from Hrithik Roshan starrer 'Kaho Naa... Pyaar Hai', said he feels that he is a "besura". "We don't practice singing...we just say a dua before our performance...and leave the rest to God," added Lucky. "My music is more like a pickle...[It is] very difficult to play," he stated.

69.title: Mobile phone explodes in man's hand in MP; video goes viral
69.article_body: A video of a mobile phone exploding into flames at a repair shop in Madhya Pradesh's Balaghat district is going viral on social media. The video showed a man checking the device when its battery exploded in his hand. The man can be seen immediately throwing the phone out of his shop.

70.title: Every min was a competition while living with Ronaldo: Ex-teammate Nani
70.article_body: Former Manchester United footballer Luís Nani, who was Cristiano Ronaldo's teammate at the club, said he lived with Ronaldo for a month, adding that "every single minute" was a competition. "Even when we were recovering, he always wanted to win," added Nani. "I showed him [that] I was never afraid of his talent...I was challenging him every time," he stated.

71.title: Man plans his arrest to get food, medical treatment in jail in Pune
71.article_body: A 35-year-old man, who was arrested for allegedly cheating a female constable of ₹10,000, has confessed that he planned his arrest to get food and medical treatment in jail in Pune. The man requires dialysis as his kidneys are damaged, a police inspector said. The investigating officer said, "[The man]...can't afford the expenses...and committed...crime in order to get himself arrested."

72.title: Bengaluru reports 1,606 new COVID-19 cases, no deaths
72.article_body: Bengaluru reported 1,606 new COVID-19 infections in a day, taking the cumulative total to 18,55,844 cases, Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) Chief Commissioner said on Thursday. No new deaths were reported, so the overall toll remained at 16,981. The number of active cases was 6,534, while the infection positivity rate stood at 6.96%.

73.title: Traffic arrangements made in Delhi for Janmashtami, police share advisory
73.article_body: In view of Janmashtami, the Delhi Traffic Police have shared a traffic advisory for today. Vehicular movement has been restricted on Mandir Marg. Traffic restrictions have also been in place around Iskcon temple at Sant Nagar near Amar Colony in South Delhi, Janmashtami Park at Punjabi Bagh near Ring Road and Santoshi Mata Mandir at Hari Nagar in West Delhi.

74.title: CBI raids Delhi Deputy CM Sisodia's residence; he says 'will give full cooperation'
74.article_body: Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) on Friday raided Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia's residence. "CBI has arrived. We are honest, building a future for lakhs of children...whoever does good work is hassled just like this, that is why our country is still not number one," Sisodia tweeted. "Will give full cooperation...so that the truth can come out soon," he added.

75.title: Damage to Europe's largest nuclear plant in Ukraine would be suicide: UN
75.article_body: UN chief António Guterres said he's "gravely concerned" about fighting near Europe's largest nuclear power plant in Ukraine. "Any potential damage to Zaporizhzhia is suicide," Guterres warned during a summit with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy and Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan in Lviv. This was the first meeting between Guterres and Zelenskyy since Russia began invading Ukraine.

76.title: Man posing as clerk cheats Pune jail guard to stop her 'transfer'
76.article_body: A man, posing as a clerk at the office of the Additional Director General (ADG) of prisons, cheated a guard at Pune's Yerawada Central Jail of ₹10,000, police said. The fraudster claimed that the guard has been transferred following multiple complaints against her and then cheated her of ₹10,000 by assuring her to stop the transfer order, police added.

77.title: 4 of family killed as van hits stationary vehicle in Ghaziabad
77.article_body: Four members of a family were killed and a 10-year-old girl was injured after a van they were travelling in collided with a stationary vehicle on the Delhi-Meerut Expressway in Ghaziabad on Thursday. SP (Rural) Iraj Raja said that the vehicle is suspected to be a truck and its driver fled from the scene. The deceased include a seven-year-old boy.

78.title: 4-day Grand Nursery Mela inaugurated at Hyderabad's People's Plaza
78.article_body: Telangana Finance and Health Minister Harish Rao inaugurated the four-day-long All India Horticulture, Agriculture and Grand Nursery Mela at Hyderabad's People's Plaza on Thursday. The fair will help people learn about different gardening methods, varied plant collections and trends in terrace gardens among other things. It will be open to the public from 11 am to 9 pm.

79.title: 5 Dadar roads to be shut from 7 am to 11 pm for 'Dahi Handi' today
79.article_body: Five roads in Mumbai's Dadar will be shut for vehicular movement from 7 am till 11 pm for 'Dahi Handi' today. Ranade Road shall be closed for vehicular traffic from Paneri junction to Dadar (west) railway station. De Silva Road shall be closed from Visava hotel and MC Jawale Road shall be closed from Kabutar Khana to railway station.

80.title: Apple warns of flaw that may let hackers take complete control of iPhones, MacBooks
80.article_body: Apple has disclosed security vulnerabilities for iPhones, iPads and MacBooks that could potentially allow attackers to take complete control of these devices. Apple's explanation of the vulnerability means a hacker could get "full admin access" to the device, SocialProof Security CEO said. Apple has also released software updates, with security experts advising users to update affected devices.

81.title: Rahul asks young fan if he'd come for match, fan says 'To hell with school', video viral
81.article_body: A video of Team India captain KL Rahul's interaction with a young fan in Harare has gone viral. The fan can be seen clicking pictures with Rahul, after which Rahul asks him if he'd come for the match. "Of course...To hell with school," the fan responds. Rahul then asks the young fan to not bunk the school.

82.title: BJYM leader booked for derogatory remarks against AIMIM's Owaisi in Hyd
82.article_body: The Hyderabad Police on Thursday booked Bharatiya Janata Yuva Morcha (BJYM) city in-charge Sai Ram Yadav for allegedly making derogatory remarks against AIMIM leader Asaduddin Owaisi. According to the case filed by Afzalgunj Police, Yadav had made the remarks during an Independence Day programme in Begum Bazar area. A case was registered under sections 341, 188 and 504 of IPC.

83.title: Bilkis Bano's rapists are 'Brahmins, have good sanskaar': BJP MLA
83.article_body: BJP's sitting MLA from Godhra, CK Raulji, has said the 11 men convicted for the rape of Bilkis Bano, who have been released from jail by the Gujarat government, are "Brahmins" and have "good sanskaar". Raulji was one of the two BJP leaders who were part of the Gujarat government panel that unanimously decided to release the rapists.

84.title: Shut your mouth: North Korea to South Korea President over denuclearisation
84.article_body: North Korea leader Kim Jong-un's sister Kim Yo-jong on Friday said South Korea President Yoon Suk-yeol should "shut his mouth" after he said that his country was willing to provide economic aid in return for denuclearisation. She called Yoon "really simple and still childish" to think that he could trade economic cooperation for the North's honour and nuclear weapons.

85.title: Major projects stuck as tree felling permission awaited: Delhi LG to CM
85.article_body: Delhi Lieutenant Governor (LG) VK Saxena has written to CM Arvind Kejriwal stating that several major projects in the national capital are stuck as permission to fell or transplant trees under the Delhi Preservation of Trees of Act, 1994 is awaited. The Tree Officer is required to give his decision within 60 days of receiving the application, LG added.

86.title: Raju Srivastava stable: Wife after Sunil Pal says his brain has stopped working
86.article_body: Raju Srivastava's wife has told news agency PTI that the comedian is stable and the doctors are treating him well. "Raju ji is a fighter and he will come back to be amongst all of us. We need your prayers and wishes," she said. Her statement comes after comedian Sunil Pal said that Srivastava's brain has stopped working.

87.title: Jonah Hill to stop promoting his films due to 20-year struggle with anxiety attacks
87.article_body: Actor-director Jonah Hill has announced that he will no longer participate in promoting his films due to a 20-year struggle with anxiety attacks. "If I made myself sicker by going out there and promoting it, I wouldn’t be acting true to myself or to the film," he said. "I won’t lose my job while working on my anxiety," he added.

88.title: Gyanvapi case plaintiff's husband claims he got threat calls from Pak
88.article_body: Sohan Lal Arya, husband of a plaintiff in Shringar Gauri-Gyanvapi mosque case, filed an FIR in Varanasi alleging that he received threat calls from a Pakistani number. Arya said the caller asked him to withdraw the petition and threatened him with 'sar tan se juda kardenge' (will behead you) warning. "We're...probing if the number [is] really from Pakistan," police said.

89.title: Farmers dump garlic sacks into MP river amid low prices; video viral
89.article_body: A video showing farmers throwing sacks full of garlic into a river in Madhya Pradesh from a bridge has gone viral on social media. Kisan Swaraj Sangathan said the farmers dumped the sacks into Parvati river as they were getting low prices for garlic. "Traders are purchasing garlic [for around ₹1-4/kg]. However, cost of production was...₹30-40/per kg," a farmer said.

90.title: Father wanted me to act, I enjoyed being among musicians: Lucky Ali
90.article_body: Singer Lucky Ali recently reminisced his early days and spoke about how he ran a carpet cleaning business to escape from his father Mehmood's wish to see him become an actor. "My father wanted me to act, but the times had changed drastically. I enjoyed being among musicians way more," Ali said. He added his music resembles India's culture.

91.title: Father got inspired by 'Lord of The Rings' for 'Krrish': Hrithik
91.article_body: Hrithik Roshan has revealed that his superhero franchise 'Krrish' has a relation with the 'Lord of The Rings' (LOTR) films. He said his father Rakesh Roshan, who directed all the films of 'Krrish' franchise, watched all 'LOTR' films and got inspired to expand the 'Koi...Mil Gaya' (2003) universe. Hrithik said "there wouldn't have been any Krrish" without the 'LOTR' films.

92.title: 'Sita Ramam' is a must watch: Venkaiah Naidu on Dulquer's film
92.article_body: Former Vice President Venkaiah Naidu has praised 'Sita Ramam', which stars Dulquer Salmaan, Mrunal Thakur and Rashmika Mandanna in the lead roles. Congratulating the makers, Venkaiah Naidu said it is after a long time that he enjoyed watching a film. He said 'Sita Ramam' unleashes a range of emotions, which makes it a "must watch" for everyone.

93.title: RTO official with assets '650 times higher' than income raided; pics show bungalow, pool
93.article_body: The Economic Offences Wing raided three premises of RTO official Santosh Paul and his wife in MP's Jabalpur. It was found that the couple had assets "650 times higher" than their known sources of income. During the searches, officials found ₹16 lakh in cash and jewellery. Their 10,000 square feet-bungalow also has a swimming pool, jacuzzi and home theatre.

94.title: Class 3 boy allegedly beaten by teacher for ₹250 school fee, dies in UP
94.article_body: A class 3 student died in a hospital on Wednesday after allegedly being beaten by his school teacher in Uttar Pradesh last week. "[He] was [brutally] beaten by his teacher because of school fees of ₹250/month. I had [paid] it online but the master didn't know," the 13-year-old boy's brother said. "His hand was fractured...There was internal bleeding," he added.

95.title: Reports say children aged below 5 to pay for full ticket for train journeys, govt clarifies
95.article_body: After some reports claimed that children aged below five will have to get a ticket for travelling in train, the government stated such reports are misleading. It stated, "[On passengers' demand]...option has been given to them to buy...ticket and book...berth for their under 5-year-old child if they want...If they don't want...separate berth...then it's free...same like it used to be earlier."

96.title: Got 78 texts on iMessage, 80 on WhatsApp: 19-yr-old Raducanu on defeating Serena
96.article_body: US Open 2021 winner Emma Raducanu, who defeated Serena Williams in straight sets in the round of 64 of Cincinnati Masters, said that she received a lot of messages after her victory. She added that she received 78 texts on iMessage and 80 on WhatsApp. "I'm an awful texter. I think I'm known for it," she further said.

97.title: Interior design startup Prolance raises $2 mn in pre-Series A round
97.article_body: Prolance, a software-as-a-service (SaaS) startup for interior designing, raised $2 million in a pre-Series A funding round. Led by Foundamental and Axilor, the round saw participation from Arali Ventures and Force Ventures. Founded in 2020 by Rama Harinath K, Vivek Parasuram, Raghunath Gururajan, Jaisimha Sathyanarayana and Manoj K, the firm helps procure interior design manufacturing materials.

98.title: Turkey cuts key interest rate amid 80% inflation
98.article_body: Turkey's central bank on Thursday cut its key rate from 14% to 13%, citing  the "weakening effects of geopolitical risks". The move comes as the Turkish lira is fast diminishing in value, and year-on-year inflation is at about 80%. The news of the rate cut led to a dip in the Turkish lira's value against the US dollar.

99.title: Jacqueline victim of larger conspiracy: Lawyer as she's named accused in extortion case
99.article_body: After Jacqueline Fernandez was named as an accused in a ₹200 crore money laundering case, her lawyer stated, "The agencies have failed to appreciate that she was cheated and conned...She is a victim of larger criminal conspiracy." "It's not fair to prosecute her with such untrue allegations," he added. She has handed over all the information, her lawyer said.

100.title: Kejriwal distributing 'revdi' to Rohingya refugees: BJP
100.article_body: Continuing the attack on the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP), BJP has alleged that Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal was distributing 'revdi' [freebies] to the Rohingya refugees. BJP leader Anurag Thakur said that just for vote bank politics, Kejriwal was ready to compromise on national security. Calling Kejriwal a 'lie minister,' he said that national security is of utmost importance to BJP.

101.title: NIA raids 2 locations in Punjab while probing IED seizure case
101.article_body: The National Investigation Agency (NIA) in Punjab searched two locations while probing the case of IED, arms and ammunition seizure from Batrara toll plaza in Haryana's Karnal district. During the raids, electronic devices and empty cartridges were recovered. So far, during the investigation, four people have been arrested after 3 IEDS, and other arms and ammunition were seized.

102.title: Rushdie’s attacker indicted by US grand jury
102.article_body: Hadi Matar, a 24-year-old man from New Jersey, has been indicted for stabbing author Salman Rushdie last week, US county prosecutors said on Thursday. Matar is scheduled to appear at an afternoon court hearing in Chautauqua County. Matar was arrested on August 12 after he stabbed Rushdie multiple times in front of a crowd at Chautauqua Institution.

103.title: Thunderstorms leave 7 dead in France and Italy, dozens injured
103.article_body: At least seven people were killed and dozens were injured as thunderstorms and hurricane-force winds swept across France and Italy on Thursday. The storms generated windspeed of over 220 km/h in some areas, France's weather agency said. The winds uprooted trees in Tuscany, and about 45,000 houses were left without electricity in Corsica.

104.title: Evacuation plan finalised for Noida twin tower demolition, residents to vacate by Aug 28
104.article_body: The evacuation plan for the demolition of the nearly 100-metre-tall twin towers of Supertech in Noida has been finalised. Both the towers will be demolished at 2.30 pm on August 28 following a Supreme Court order. The residents of Emerald Court and ATS Village societies will have to vacate their homes by 7 am on August 28.

105.title: NASA Artemis I Mission to carry toys, mannequins, Alexa to Moon
105.article_body: NASA's Artemis I rocket will take off to the Moon on August 29. The rocket has been reportedly moved to the launch pad for final preparation. While no human crew will travel aboard, the rocket will be carrying three mannequins, toys, Amazon Alexa, etc as a part of a tradition that began in the 1960s of NASA spacecraft bearing mementoes.

106.title: BJP left cows to their own fate amid lumpy skin disease: Surjewala
106.article_body: Senior Congress leader Randeep Singh Surjewala said that as the lumpy skin disease spreads in Haryana, the BJP has left cows to their own fate. Alleging that all the BJP does is politics in the name of cows, he said the party had just been mute spectators. He added that within a month, 30,000 cows were infected and 200 died.

107.title: Red alert in Odisha as low pressure forms in Bay of Bengal
107.article_body: The Bhubaneswar Meteorological Centre issued a red alert for extremely heavy rainfall in parts of Odisha on Friday, as a new low pressure area formed in the Bay of Bengal. While the red alert was issued for Keonjhar and Mayurbhanj districts, an orange alert was issued for 14 districts, including Cuttack. Yellow warning was issued for seven districts, including Puri.

108.title: Who are the Best Actor and Best Actress nominees at Filmfare Awards 2022?
108.article_body: The Best Actor nominees at Filmfare Awards 2022 are Dhanush (Atrangi Re), Ranveer Singh ('83), Sidharth Malhotra (Shershaah) and Vicky Kaushal (Sardar Udham). Kangana Ranaut (Thalaivii), Kiara Advani (Shershaah), Kriti Sanon (Mimi), Parineeti Chopra (Sandeep Aur Pinky Faraar), Taapsee Pannu (Rashmi Rocket) and Vidya Balan (Sherni) are Best Actress nominees. The event will be held on August 30.

109.title: How many matches will Team India play from 2023 to 2027 and against whom?
109.article_body: As per the men's Future Tours Program for 2023-2027 cycle, India are scheduled to play 38 Tests, 42 ODIs and 61 T20Is. India will face Australia and England the most during the cycle. India will play 10 Tests, six ODIs and 10 T20Is each against the two countries. India will play 21 international matches against New Zealand in the cycle.

110.title: BJP youth wing members throw eggs at Siddaramaiah's car in Kodagu
110.article_body: BJP youth wing members threw eggs and waved black flags at Leader of Opposition and former Chief Minister of Karnataka, Siddaramaiah, in Kodagu. The protest was against Siddaramaiah's statement on the need for the Hindutva activists to put up Veer Savarkar's photograph in a Muslim area in Shivamogga. The protest led to the clashes between Congress and BJP workers.

111.title: AAP releases 2nd list of 9 candidates for Gujarat Assembly polls
111.article_body: The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) on Thursday released the second list of nine candidates for the upcoming Gujarat Assembly elections. The party has nominated Raju Karpada from Chotila constituency, Piyush Parmar from Mangrol (Junagadh) and Karsanbhai Karmur from Jamnagar North. Nimisha Khunt, Prakashbhai Contractor and Vikram Sorani have been nominated from Gondal, Choryasi and Wankaner respectively.

112.title: Fintech startup Jar raises $22.6 mn, valuation reaches $300 mn
112.article_body: Fintech startup Jar, an app for savings and investments, has raised $22.6 million in its Series B funding round. The round was led by Tiger Global Management and saw participation from Arkam Ventures, Eximius Ventures, Force Ventures, LetsVenture, Rocketship Venture Capital and WEH Venture, among others. After this funding, the valuation of the one-year-old startup stands at $300 million.

113.title: Men & women are equal in every aspect, change your mindset: Mohan Bhagwat
113.article_body: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat at an event said men and women are equal in every aspect barring biological differences. "Men don't need to attempt to uplift women because they are more capable than men...they don't need any guidance," he said. "It's beyond the reach of men to guide them," he added, urging men to change their parochial attitude towards women.

114.title: 40-yr-old vegetable seller held for selling drugs in Odisha's Ganjam
114.article_body: A 40-year-old vegetable seller was arrested in Odisha's Ganjam for allegedly possessing drugs worth over ₹13 lakh, an official said. Acting on a tip-off, Excise personnel raided the vegetable shop of Bhaskar Dora under Golanthara police station area. They seized around 101 grams of brown sugar, 100 grams of opium and a huge amount of marijuana, deputy excise commissioner said.

115.title: Very heavy rainfall warning issued for several states, list released
115.article_body: The IMD, in its latest bulletin, issued very heavy rainfall warning for several states for the next few days. Isolated very heavy rainfall is likely over Jharkhand and Odisha on August 20. It is very likely over Madhya Pradesh on August 21 and 22.  Further, east Rajasthan may witness very heavy rainfall on August 21 and 22.

116.title: 40-year-old policeman attacked by inmates in Nashik Central Jail
116.article_body: A 40-year-old policeman, Prabhucharan Nanaji Patil, deployed in Nashik Central Jail was attacked by some inmates who had allegedly changed their barracks without permission on Thursday, an official said. The group of 10-12 prisoners, serving time on murder charges, allegedly attacked the policeman with stones. "He has suffered injuries on his head, limbs and is hospitalised," the official added.

117.title: DOLO-650 makers spent ₹1,000 crore on doctors to prescribe tablet, Supreme Court told
117.article_body: The Federation of Medical and Sales Representatives' Associations of India informed the Supreme Court that CBDT has accused DOLO-650 makers of spending ₹1,000 crore on doctors to prescribe it. It said the makers distributed freebies worth ₹1,000 crore to doctors to prescribe DOLO-650 to ensure higher profit margin as companies can fix price of tablets above 500mg without government regulation.

118.title: Nitish Kumar is like women who change boyfriends any time: BJP leader
118.article_body: BJP National General Secretary Kailash Vijayvargiya on Thursday said that Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar is similar to women in foreign countries who change their boyfriends any time. Vijayvargiya added that it is never known whose hand Kumar may hold or leave. This comes after JD(U) chief Kumar broke ties with BJP and formed an alliance with RJD in Bihar.

119.title: Delhi reports nearly 2,000 new COVID-19 cases & 8 deaths, positivity rate at 9.42%
119.article_body:
Delhi reported 1,964 new COVID-19 cases on Thursday as compared to Wednesday's 1,652
cases, as per data shared by the health department. Eight more people succumbed to the infection in the last 24 hours, while the positivity rate dropped to 9.42% from 9.92% reported the previous day. The national capital now has 6,826 active COVID-19 cases.

120.title: Mahesh Babu-Pooja Hegde film to release in April 2023
120.article_body: The makers of Mahesh Babu's upcoming film, tentatively titled 'SSMB28', have shared the release date of the Trivikram directorial. Production house Haarika & Hassine Creations on Thursday tweeted that the Mahesh Babu film will release on April 28, 2023. They promised it to be a "high-octane entertainer" with Mahesh in a "scintillating massy look". The film also stars Pooja Hedge.

121.title: Anurag wasn't convinced about Pankaj: Mukesh on 'Gangs...' casting
121.article_body: Casting director Mukesh Chhabra said Anurag Kashyap wasn't sure about casting Pankaj Tripathi in 'Gangs of Wasseypur'. Mukesh, who was the casting director of 'Gangs of Wasseypur', said he convinced Anurag to audition Pankaj along with an actor he was keen to cast in the film. He said Anurag found Pankaj's audition "very good" and decided to cast him.

122.title: Today in BJP there are no elections: Subramanian Swamy
122.article_body: Former MP Subramanian Swamy on Thursday criticised the BJP for "no" organisational elections, a day after the party rejigged its parliamentary board. "Today in BJP there are no elections...To every post is nominated a member with the approval of Modi," he tweeted. Meanwhile, BJP sources said it was a party convention that the president nominates members to different positions.

123.title: All options open: RCP Singh on whether he will join BJP
123.article_body: Former national president of JD(U) RCP Singh on Thursday said "all options" are "open" as far as joining a political party was concerned, including an entry into the BJP. Singh denied rumours that he was the BJP's eyes and ears in the JD(U). He went on to criticise Bihar CM Nitish Kumar for switching alliance partners once again.

124.title: Mumbai sees 1,201 new COVID-19 cases, highest since June 30
124.article_body: Mumbai reported 1,201 fresh cases of COVID-19 on Thursday, which is the highest since June 30 when 1,265 infections were recorded. As per Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation, the city also reported two deaths due to COVID-19 in the last 24 hours, while the number of active cases stood at 5,712. On Wednesday, Mumbai saw 975 new COVID-19 cases and two deaths.

125.title: Judicial custody of Partha Chatterjee, Arpita extended till Aug 31
125.article_body: A Kolkata court on Thursday extended the judicial custody of former West Bengal minister Partha Chatterjee and his aide Arpita Mukherjee till August 31. They were arrested last month in connection with a teacher recruitment scam case. Earlier, the Enforcement Directorate recovered cash worth around ₹50 crore, foreign currency, jewellery and gold biscuits from premises allegedly linked to Arpita.

126.title: My wife has illegally kept our minor children in Pakistan, claims producer Mushtaq
126.article_body: Bombay High Court has sought Union government's response to a petition filed by producer Mushtaq Nadiadwala claiming his two minor children have been illegally detained in Pakistan by his wife. The visiting visa granted to his children by Pakistani authorities expired in October 2021, it said. She herself might have been coerced into extending her stay in Pakistan, Mushtaq added.

127.title: Giant sharks bigger than school bus once lived in seas, ate other predators
127.article_body: As per researchers, a giant shark over 50-foot in size from nose to tail roamed the oceans millions of years ago. The megalodon that was bigger than an entire school bus could devour a creature the size of a killer whale in just five bites, they suggested. It had a gaping jaw to help feed on big creatures.

128.title: No bridge to cross river, MP woman tied to tube to reach hospital
128.article_body: A pregnant woman was tied to a rubber tube to cross a river to reach a hospital in MP's Harda district, as the connectivity was disrupted because of heavy rain. The woman's family took the woman across the river on a rubber tube, after which she was taken to the hospital in an ambulance.

129.title: Maharashtra recognises Dahi Handi as sports, Govindas to get insurance cover of ₹10 lakh
129.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde on Thursday announced that Dahi Handi festival will be recognised under the sports category in the state. He added that 'Govindas' will get jobs under the sports category and an insurance cover of ₹10 lakh will be provided to them. A 'Pro-Dahi Handi' will also be introduced in the state, Shinde said.

130.title: 12 children rescued from train in Bihar's Muzaffarpur, 7 arrested
130.article_body: At least 12 children were rescued and seven people were arrested from a train in Bihar's Muzaffarpur district, the Government Railway Police (GRP) said. They were rescued from a coach of Karmabhoomi Express. "During interrogation, accused told the police that they were taking the children to Ludhiana, Amritsar and Saharanpur to make them work in factories," an official statement said.

131.title: AAP ready to compromise national security for vote bank politics: Thakur
131.article_body: Amid the row over accommodation of Rohingya refugees in Delhi, Union Minister Anurag Thakur on Thursday criticised AAP and alleged their government is ready to compromise national security for vote bank politics. "Rohingyas who live here and are illegal migrants are given free water, electricity, ration; now even flats were to be given to them by Delhi government," Thakur said.

132.title: There'll be no coalition: DK Shivakumar ahead of K'taka Assembly polls
132.article_body: Karnataka Congress chief DK Shivakumar said the party won't form any coalition ahead of the 2023 Assembly election in Karnataka. "Congress will fight alone in 224 Assembly constituencies and we are confident that we'll form the government with a thumping majority of over 130+ seats," DK Shivakumar said. He further said that he's least bothered about who becomes the CM.

133.title: 31-year-old man kills 65-yr-old saint with a sword in Raj, arrested
133.article_body: A 31-year-old man was arrested for allegedly killing a 65-year-old saint with a sword on Tuesday night in Rajasthan's Hanumangarh district, police said. The body of the deceased was found lying in a pool of blood in his hut. Sangaria police station SHO Hanumana Ram said that the reason behind the crime is currently unknown.

134.title: Suggested to re-dub Punjabi dialogues: Gippy on Aamir's 'Laal...'
134.article_body: Punjabi actor Gippy Grewal said he suggested 'Laal Singh Chaddha' makers to re-dub the Punjabi dialogues of the film after he watched its rushes. He said that while the makers agreed with him, "they didn't change it". Gippy agreed that the film failed to connect with its audience to a certain level because of the poor Punjabi diction.

135.title: I pray Janmashtami inspires us to follow path of virtue: Prez Murmu
135.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu on Thursday greeted citizens on the eve of Janmashtami, praying the festival inspires all "to follow the path of virtue in our thought, words and action". "On the auspicious occasion...I extend my warm greetings...to all the fellow citizens," she said. Lord Krishna's life and teachings included the message of well being and virtue, Murmu said.

136.title: Don't 'betray' Indian civilisation: Tharoor to BJP over Rohingyas row
136.article_body: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor criticised the Centre on the row over the accommodation of Rohingyas. He said that the "confusion" in the government is a disgrace to a nation that has served on the executive committee of the UNHCR. Union Minister Hardeep Singh Puri had earlier said that Rohingya refugees would be shifted to EWS flats in Delhi's Bakkarwala area.

137.title: Criminals fearless in Bihar after grand alliance formed govt: BJP
137.article_body: The BJP on Thursday said that criminals in Bihar have become "fearless" and cited recent cases of heinous crimes in the state and the alleged involvement of some Ministers in criminal cases. "The state is returning to jungle raj," said BJP leader Ravi Shankar Prasad. Prasad criticised the government over Bihar Minister Kartikeya Singh's suspected involvement in a kidnapping case.

138.title: Gangster-turned-politician Mukhtar's premises raided in PMLA case
138.article_body: ED on Thursday raided premises linked to gangster-turned-politician Mukhtar Ansari in connection with a case filed under Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA). Raids were conducted in around 11 locations in Uttar Pradesh and Delhi. The official residence of his brother, BSP MP Afzal Ansari, was also raided. Earlier, UP Police seized assets worth ₹14.9 from Afzal under Gangster Act.

139.title: Children living near fracking wells at higher risk of leukaemia: Study
139.article_body: Children who live near oil and gas fracking sites are at a higher risk of developing leukaemia, a study stated. "Unconventional oil and gas development (UOG) can use and release chemicals...linked to cancer," the study author said. "So the potential for children living near UOG to be exposed to these chemical carcinogens is a major public health concern," she added.

140.title: Army jawan on leave shot dead by 2 men on bike in Bihar's Patna
140.article_body: An Army jawan, who was on leave, was allegedly shot dead by two men on a bike in a crowded area in Bihar's Patna. The jawan, who was posted in Arunachal Pradesh, was on his way to board Rajdhani Express to Guwahati along with his brother. They also tried to shoot his brother, but he managed to run away.

141.title: Finland's 36-year-old PM Sanna responds to drug use allegations after leaked party video
141.article_body: Finland's 36-year-old PM Sanna Marin has responded to drug use allegations after a video of her partying got leaked. She said, "I haven't used drugs myself, or anything other than alcohol. I've danced, sung and partied and done perfectly legal things. I have also not been in a situation where I would know that others are doing it that way."

142.title: Identify the animal: IFS officer on video of man pulling leopard by its tail
142.article_body: A video of a person pulling a leopard by its tail and one of its hind legs was shared on Twitter by IFS officer Parveen Kaswan. "Identify the animal here!!" he wrote in the caption. "Video is from unknown location...This is not the way to handle or treat wildlife friends," Kaswan added.

143.title: Rape & murder accused who fled custody beaten to death by mob in Assam
143.article_body: A rape and murder accused in his 40s, who ran away from police custody two days ago, was beaten to death by some villagers in Assam's Lakhimpur on Thursday, police said. The accused was already severely injured and unconscious when a police team reached the spot. The man had over a dozen cases of dacoity, rape and murder against him.

144.title: Ali Asgar to enter 'Jhalak Dikhhla Jaa' as Dadi of 'Comedy Nights...'
144.article_body: Actor Ali Asgar has confirmed that he will be participating in 'Jhalak Dikhhla Jaa 10'. He said he will be entering the show as his popular character Dadi from 'Comedy Nights With Kapil'. Calling the news a "cherry on the cake", Asgar said he cannot wait for the audience to witness "the dancing diva by her side".

145.title: SUN Mobility and EVeez to deploy 10,000 electric two-wheelers by 2023
145.article_body: Electric vehicle (EV) infrastructure provider SUN Mobility has partnered with EVeez to deploy over 10,000 electric two-wheelers across the country by 2023. The partnership will also focus on EV subscriptions for last-mile and middle-mile connectivity. As part of the plan, 200 EVs will be added to EVeez's on-ground fleet every month which currently has 250 vehicles deployed in Delhi.

146.title: Will respond soon: Nitish on BJP's 'return of jungle raj' allegations
146.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar on Thursday dismissed allegations of "return of jungle raj" by the BJP and asserted that he will respond to them at an appropriate time. When asked about a criminal case involving Kartikeya Singh, the state's law minister, Kumar said, "The matter is being looked into. Whatever is needed will be done."

147.title: Will keep making 'Golmaal' till I'm making films: Rohit Shetty
147.article_body: Director Rohit Shetty has confirmed that Golmaal's fifth instalment is in the pipeline. He said the project got delayed due to the backlog created by the coronavirus pandemic. "It might be right after 'Singham' or maybe another year post that. I enjoy that space and will keep making 'Golmaal' till I am making films," he said.

148.title: Examining prospect of giving job to family of Dalit student: Raj CM
148.article_body: Days after a nine-year-old Dalit boy was beaten to death in Rajasthan, CM Ashok Gehlot said that the government was examining the possibility of providing a government job to a family member of the student. Gehlot said the accused was arrested immediately and that assistance of ₹5 lakh was given to the boy's family from the CM's Relief Fund.

149.title: Don't believe in them: Chahal on divorce rumours as Dhanashree drops 'Chahal' from Insta
149.article_body: Cricketer Yuzvendra Chahal took to Instagram Stories to rubbish rumours that claimed that he and his wife Dhanashree Verma are separating. The divorce rumours surfaced after Dhanashree dropped 'Chahal' from her Instagram name and Chahal shared an Instagram Story that read 'New life loading'. "Don't believe in...rumours pertaining to our relationship. Kindly. Put an end to it," Chahal wrote.

150.title: 'What's your suggestion, abort?': Debina to fan on 2nd pregnancy 4 months after 1st child
150.article_body: Actress Debina Bonnerjee, who recently conducted an 'Ask me anything' session on Instagram, addressed some questions related to her pregnancy announcement. Reacting to an Instagram user who suggested she should have waited for at least a year for her second pregnancy, she said, "What's your suggestion in such a situation? Abort?" Debina had welcomed her first child in April.

151.title: Maharashtra govt launches MHADA Pune lottery for 5,000 houses
151.article_body: The Maharashtra government on Thursday launched the MHADA Pune lottery for 5,211 houses in Pune, Pimpri-Chinchwad, Solapur and Kolhapur districts. A computerised draw was launched for 278 flats under MHADA's schemes, 2,845 flats on a first-come, first-served basis and 2,088 flats under the 20% comprehensive housing scheme. The latter includes flats under Pune Municipal Corporation, among others.

152.title: India defeat Zimbabwe, record two 10-wicket ODI wins in a year for 1st time in history
152.article_body: India defeated Zimbabwe by 10 wickets in the first ODI in Harare on Thursday. It's India's second 10-wicket ODI victory in 2022. India have recorded two 10-wicket ODI victories in a calendar year for the first time in history. India had defeated England by 10 wickets on July 12. India have now won 13 ODIs in a row against Zimbabwe.

153.title: Tata Motors gets order of 921 electric buses for BMTC
153.article_body: Tata Motors on Thursday announced that it has won an order of 921 electric buses from Bengaluru Metropolitan Transport Corporation (BMTC). According to the contract, Tata Motors will supply, operate and maintain 12-metre electric buses for a period of 12 years. The order is paramount for Bengaluru's growing need for clean, urban mass mobility, said BMTC Managing Director Sathyavathi.

154.title: Online scamming racket busted in Jharkhand's Deoghar, 14 arrested
154.article_body: Police busted an online scamming racket and arrested 14 cybercriminals in Jharkhand's Deoghar district, an official said on Thursday. Acting on a tip-off, a raid was conducted on Babhankund village on Wednesday and 14 accused, aged between 19 and 46, were arrested, Deoghar Deputy Superintendent of Police said. Police seized 15 mobile phones and 23 SIM cards from their possession.

155.title: Audience's preferences have changed after pandemic: Madhavan on B'wood vs South debate
155.article_body: While talking about the debate between South and Hindi cinema, R Madhavan said, "I'd like to clearly state only a few films have done better than those of Hindi stars. They're Pushpa, the KGF films, the Baahubali films...and RRR." He added, "I think the audience's preferences have changed after the pandemic. They are consuming content from all over the world."

156.title: Welcoming Bilkis Bano's rapists 'slap on face of society': TRS MLC
156.article_body: The welcome of rapists and murderers involved in the Bilkis Bano case is a slap on the face of a just society, said TRS MLC Kavitha. All 11 convicts, sentenced to life imprisonment in the 2002 case of Bilkis Bano's gang-rape and murder of her seven family members, were released and were reportedly welcomed with sweets and garlands.

157.title: B'luru Police files case after pro-Pakistan slogans raised on Clubhouse
157.article_body: Days after pro-Pakistan slogans were made in a group on Clubhouse by people suspected to be from Bengaluru, the city police have registered a case and initiated a probe. According to the complaint registered at the Sampigehalli police station, the group displayed Pakistan's flag, the national anthem of the country was played and anti-India slogans were raised.

158.title: Mohanlal's 'L2: Empuraan' to be made on ₹400 crore budget: Reports
158.article_body: Prithviraj Sukumaran's upcoming directorial 'L2: Empuraan’ will reportedly be made on a budget of ₹400 crore. A report stated that the actor-director is eyeing to make the commercial entertainer "a Pan-World release like Prabhas' Project K". The makers will soon share more details on the film, which stars Mohanlal in the lead role.

159.title: West Bengal to have sports university: Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee
159.article_body: West Bengal Chief Minister on Wednesday said her government will soon set up a sports university in Kolkata. "We plan to start a dedicated university for sports so that the younger generations, who are interested in sports, do not have to go anywhere else," she said. "I promise you...we'll always try to support every dream of our sportspersons," she added.

160.title: TMC won't last for 6 months, December is their deadline: Suvendu Adhikari
160.article_body: West Bengal Leader of Opposition Suvendu Adhikari on Thursday said the ruling Trinamool Congress (TMC) won't last even for the next six months in the state. "December is their deadline," Adhikari said. His comment came after the ruling TMC put up posters claiming that a "new and reformed TMC" is coming in the next six months.

161.title: Customs officials seize 435 gms of gold worth ₹23 lakh at Hyd airport
161.article_body: Customs officials seized 435.7 grams of gold worth ₹23.14 lakh from a passenger at Hyderabad's Rajiv Gandhi International Airport on Thursday. The passenger arrived by a flight from Sharjah and tried to smuggle the gold by concealing it in an electric blender and electric sander, officials said, adding that the gold was recovered after breaking the appliances open.

162.title: HyperTrack raises $25 mn in Series A funding round
162.article_body: Logistics startup HyperTrack has raised $25 million in its Series A funding round, led by WestBridge Capital and existing investor Nexus Venture Partners. HyperTrack was founded in 2017 and had 30 clients and had even raised funds totalling $8.5 million by 2018, however, the company shut its India operations in 2019. The company was relaunched in India in 2021.

163.title: 4, including 3 of a family, killed as car rams into truck in Ajmer
163.article_body: Four people, including three of a family, were killed when the car they were travelling in rammed into a truck moving ahead of them in Rajasthan's Ajmer, police said. The deceased were identified as 40-year-old Ankit Agarwal, 37-year-old Rakhi, 11-year-old Pratham and 40-year-old driver Mohammad Qayoom. The passengers were on their way to Bhilwara when the accident occurred, police said.

164.title: Fake currency with face value of ₹2.5 lakh seized in Hyderabad, 2 held
164.article_body: The Hyderabad Police on Thursday arrested two persons for printing and circulating fake Indian currency notes in Hyderabad and other cities. Fake currency notes in denominations of 100, 200, 500 and 2000, altogether worth ₹2.5 lakh, were seized from the accused. "The plan was to circulate it in the market and cheat traders," DCP (south) said.

165.title: Yes Bank invests undisclosed amount in Venture Catalysts
165.article_body: Yes Bank has invested an undisclosed amount in an integrated incubator platform Venture Catalysts Group Funds (Venture Catalysts), Beams Fintech Fund and 9Unicorns. The Beams Fintech Fund invests in growth stage companies and the 9Unicorns is an early-stage sector-agnostic investor. Notably, SBI recently inaugurated a branch in Bengaluru dedicated to startups.

166.title: 12 traffic junctions in Hyderabad to be improved  at a cost of ₹36 cr
166.article_body: The Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) has decided to improve 12 traffic junctions in the city for ₹3 crore per junction. In 2016, the GHMC proposed to upgrade 111 traffic crossings in six months, however, the work is still not finished. GHMC is following Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) which renovated 35 junctions for ₹100 crore in 2 years.

167.title: 26 killed in Algerian wildfires; 3,200 hectares of forests burnt
167.article_body: Forest fires in east Algeria have killed 26 people, including 24 from country's El Tarf region, Interior Minister Kamel Beldjoud said, quoting a provisional government report. He said 39 fires had started in 14 regions and among them 16 had started in El Tarf. Beldjoud said 3,200 hectares (over 12 sq miles) of forest land has been destroyed since August.

168.title: My daughter passed TET, she has certificate: Mondal amid job row
168.article_body: Arrested TMC leader Anubrata Mondal on Thursday denied that his daughter was appointed to a primary school without clearing the Teacher Eligibility Test (TET). "She has passed the test and has a certificate to prove it," Mondal said. Calcutta High Court summoned Sukanya Mondal after a petitioner alleged that she got the post of a teacher without clearing the TET.

169.title: Basketball player pushed from stadium roof by 3 for resisting rape in Moga
169.article_body: An 18-year-old basketball player was reportedly pushed from the stadium roof by three youths for resisting rape in Punjab's Moga. The incident took place on August 12, when she had gone to the stadium for practice, her father said in the complaint. She suffered multiple fractures and injuries in her legs and jaw and is currently hospitalised.

170.title: Lyricist Ko Sesha shares pic of meat in veg meal, asks Swiggy's K'taka head to apologise
170.article_body: Lyricist Ko Sesha took to Twitter to call out Swiggy for their customer service after he found meat pieces in a vegetarian dish he had ordered from The Bowl Company in Bengaluru. "What's worse was Swiggy customer care offered me...compensation of ₹70 for 'offending my religious sentiments'," he wrote. He further demanded Swiggy's Karnataka head to apologise to him.

171.title: CoWIN app with UIP's pilot likely to be launched in Sept: Report
171.article_body: Universal Immunisation Programme (UIP) is likely to be launched on the revamped version of CoWIN application in mid-September, a report said. The pilot project, which will be implemented in two districts of each state and Union Territories, will help to digitise session planning and update vaccination status. UIP is likely to be rolled out nationally after three months.

172.title: Indian apps saw 200% increase in active monthly users in 2021: Google
172.article_body: Google data shows that there has been a 200% increase in active monthly users in 2021 as compared to 2019, especially for applications and games published by Indian developers. Indian apps and games have witnessed a 150% increase outside India for the time spent metric. Google Play now has 2.5 billion active users globally.

173.title: 16 killed, 18 missing in flash floods in western China
173.article_body: At least 16 people have been killed and 18 are missing after a rainstorm caused a landslide and flash flooding in western China, state media CCTV said on Thursday. The rains on Wednesday night affected over 6,000 people in Qinghai province, CCTV said. Emergency authorities described the flooding as a "mountain torrent".

174.title: Ukraine Prez Zelenskyy to host UN chief, Turkish Prez in Lviv
174.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy will be hosting Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan and UN Secretary-General António Guterres in Lviv on Thursday. Apart from the diplomatic efforts to end the Russia-Ukraine war, the situation in Russian-controlled Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant in south Ukraine will be discussed. The leaders will also explore ways to expand grain exports from Ukraine.

175.title: Warwickshire sign Mohammed Siraj for the County Championship
175.article_body: Warwickshire has signed India pacer Mohammed Siraj for the last three matches of the County Championship season. "I can't wait to join up with the Bears squad.
