Charmme said she "was born to produce films and nothing else".

349.title: Centre was 'secretly' trying to give residence to Rohingyas in Delhi: Sisodia
349.article_body: After the mix-up over Rohingya refugees' accommodation, Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia alleged that the central government was "secretly" trying to give "permanent residence" to Rohingya refugees in Delhi. He said the Centre was calling the move to shift Rohingyas to EWS flats an "achievement", but later started shifting the blame on Delhi government after Aam Aadmi Party opposed it.

350.title: Explosion hits Kabul mosque shattering windows in nearby buildings, casualties feared
350.article_body: A huge explosion struck a mosque in Kabul during evening prayers on Wednesday, witnesses and police said, with many feared dead or injured. Police said there were multiple casualties but did not say how many. Al Jazeera quoted an unidentified official as giving a death toll of 20. Witnesses said the explosion shattered windows in nearby buildings.

351.title: Faisal Shaikh to participate in 'Jhalak Dikhhla Jaa 10': Reports
351.article_body: Social media influencer Faisal Shaikh, also known as Mr Faisu, has signed another reality show. The actor, who is currently seen on 'Khatron Ke Khiladi 12', will be reportedly participating in the upcoming dance reality show 'Jhalak Dikhhla Jaa 10'. The show, hosted by Maniesh Paul, will see Karan Johar, Madhuri Dixit and Nora Fatehi as the judges.

352.title: Don't want to be called 'Punjab Ki Katrina Kaif' anymore: Shehnaaz
352.article_body: Shehnaaz Gill said she now prefers to be called "Shehnaaz from India". She said, "I don't want to be Punjab Ki Katrina Kaif. I just want to be Shehnaaz Gill from India." The title 'Punjab Ki Katrina Kaif' was coined by Shehnaaz on 'Bigg Boss 13'. Earlier, she shared that the title suits Katrina more as she married Vicky Kaushal.

353.title: Don Anant Singh's aide made Bihar Law Minister: RK Singh on Kartikeya
353.article_body: Union Minister RK Singh on Wednesday said that RJD leader Kartikeya Singh, who faces an arrest warrant in a kidnapping case, should be removed from Bihar Cabinet. Further, he questioned, "How has Kartikeya...been made Law Minister [even thought he's] the right hand of Anant Singh, who is a don?" The minister said that "Jungle raj part-2" is back in Bihar.

354.title: 5 Bangladeshi militants sentenced to death for 2015 bombing
354.article_body: Five militants of the banned outfit Jamaat-ul-Mujahideen Bangladesh (JMB) were sentenced to death on Wednesday for bombing a mosque inside a Navy installation in Chattogram in 2015. The Anti-Terrorism Tribunal judge said bombing inside a naval base was tantamount to attacking Bangladesh's sovereignty. Four of the convicts were present for trial, while one was tried in absentia.

355.title: Man asks Jaishankar how to change Indians' mentality for Chinese products, he replies
355.article_body: A member of Indian diaspora in Bangkok asked EAM S Jaishankar how Indians' mentality can be changed to avoid Chinese products. He replied, "Kind of support...MSMEs should've got in India...in 1990s didn't take place." "You've to give people an alternative...It'll happen when there are good Indian products...Aatmanirbhar Bharat is also about overcoming...colonial mentality," he added.

356.title: UP MLA Azam Khan booked for threatening witness in land grab case
356.article_body: Samajwadi Party MLA Azam Khan on Wednesday was booked for allegedly threatening a witness in a land grab case in which he is an accused. "An FIR has been lodged against Azam Khan and five other unidentified persons for threatening a witness of a case," said police officer Ashok Kumar. The case is being heard at an MP/MLA court.

357.title: Portfolio distribution in Bihar done without logic: Ghulam Nabi Azad
357.article_body: Raising questions over the new ministerial berths in Bihar, senior Congress leader Ghulam Nabi Azad said that the portfolio distribution was done without any logic. He said while the formation of the government was a welcome step, Congress got a raw deal. "It is really surprising that no one from the party pressed for equal share of berths," he added.

358.title: PhysicsWallah acquihires edtech startup FreeCo
358.article_body: Edtech unicorn PhysicsWallah has acquihired doubt-solving edtech and resource management firm FreeCo. PhysicsWallah and FreeCo will collaborate on the content library, and the firm plans to use FreeCo's team experience and will employ 15 members from the latter. PhysicsWallah became India's 101st unicorn after it raised $100 million in its Series A funding round in June 2021.

359.title: J&K to get 25 lakh new voters in revised list: Poll official
359.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir will get about 25 lakh new voters, including outsiders, after the special summary revision of electoral rolls is completed, Jammu and Kashmir Chief Electoral Officer Hirdesh Kumar said on Wednesday. The rolls are being revised for the first time after Article 370 was abrogated in the erstwhile state. The revision is set for completion by November 25.

360.title: 3 arrested in Agra for allegedly raising anti-India slogans
360.article_body: Three people have been arrested in Agra for allegedly raising anti-India slogans during a 'Tiranga yatra' in Gokulpura area on Independence Day, the police said. A case has been registered under Section 153-B (causing disharmony) of the Indian Penal Code against Faizan, Sadab and Muhajjam, and all three have been arrested. The miscreants are aged between 19 to 21 years.

361.title: Bilkis Bano issues statement as 11 convicts in gangrape case walk free, says 'I'm numb'
361.article_body: Bilkis Bano, in a statement issued after 11 convicts sentenced to life imprisonment for gangraping her and killing seven members of her family walked free, said, "The trauma...washed over me again...I'm...numb." "I appeal to...Gujarat government...Give me back my right to live without fear and in peace," she added. Bilkis stated no one enquired about her safety before taking this decision.

362.title: Russia unveils model of new space station, pic surfaces
362.article_body: Russia's space agency has unveiled a physical model of what a planned new Russian-built space station will look like. The model dubbed 'ROSS' by Russian state media was presented at 'Army-2022', a military-industrial exhibition outside Moscow. Earlier, the space agency's chief had said that Russia will quit the ISS after 2024 and is working to develop its own orbital station.

363.title: Investment firm Stride Ventures raises $200 mn to lend to startups
363.article_body: Venture debt firm, Stride Ventures announced the close of 'Stride Ventures India Fund II'. The capital was raised from banks, family offices, corporate treasuries, sovereign funds, private equity funds, insurance firms and high networth individuals. The fund's portfolio includes CredAvenue (Yubi), MyGlamm, Zepto, BluSmart, among others and it has disbursed over ₹1,600 crore in 70+ firms.

364.title: Land acquisition delays Mumbai-Ahmedabad bullet train project
364.article_body: Slow land acquisition could delay the completion of the Mumbai-Ahmedabad bullet train project, a report said on Wednesday. According to the Railways Ministry, 75.25% of the project's land has been acquired in Maharashtra, 98.8% in Gujarat and 100% in Dadra and Nagar Haveli. The bullet train project, which was initially set for completion by 2023, has had several deadline extensions.

365.title: Delhi sees 1,652 new COVID cases, positivity rate drops to 9.92% from 19.20%
365.article_body: Delhi reported 1,652 new COVID-19 cases on Wednesday as compared to 917 cases recorded on Tuesday, while the positivity rate dropped to 9.92% from 19.20%. The national capital also reported eight deaths due to COVID-19 in the last 24 hours, according to the health department's latest bulletin. As many as 1,702 patients recovered in the last 24 hours.

366.title: I eat to 90% of my stomach's capacity, I don't consume sugar, gluten: Virat Kohli
366.article_body: Talking about his diet in a recent interview with Indian Express, Virat Kohli said, "The dos and don'ts for me are quite simple— no processed sugar, no gluten." He added, "I also avoid dairy as much as possible. Another trick that has helped me keep my health in check is to eat to 90 per cent of my stomach's capacity."

367.title: Alia and I once drunk-dialled Vicky before his wedding with Katrina: Karan Johar
367.article_body: Karan Johar, during an episode of 'Koffee With Karan', revealed how he and Alia Bhatt drunk-dialled Vicky Kaushal ahead of his wedding with Katrina Kaif. "Alia and I...drunk-dialled Vicky. We were drinking wine and star gazing, and...we were wondering who we could call," he stated. "We...have known Katrina for a long time...Her getting married made us so emotional," Karan added.

368.title: List of gifts worth over ₹5 crore received by Jacqueline from conman Sukesh surfaces
368.article_body: Jacqueline Fernandez, who has been named as accused in a ₹200 crore money laundering case, received designer bags from Gucci and Chanel, shoes from Louis Vuitton and Christian Louboutin, four cats and diamond jewellery from conman Sukesh Chandrasekhar. She also got a Mini Cooper and diamond bracelet among other gifts. ED alleged Chandrasekhar gave Fernandez gifts worth over ₹5 crore.

369.title: 'Trapped' Shinde-faction MLAs are contacting us: Aaditya Thackeray
369.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Aaditya Thackeray on Wednesday claimed "trapped" legislators in the Eknath Shinde-led faction of the party were contacting supporters of Uddhav Thackeray after the Maharashtra Cabinet was expanded last week. He said, "Our doors are open for all who want to join us back." All defectors must quit as MLAs and prepare for re-elections, Aaditya added.

370.title: Hardeep Puri trolled by Amit Shah: Congress leader on Rohingya row
370.article_body: Commenting on the mix-up between Union Minister Hardeep Singh Puri and the Home Ministry over the accommodation of Rohingya refugees in Delhi, Congress leader Supriya Shrinate tweeted, "[Puri's] words turned out to be completely wrong. We're not saying this, the Home Minister himself is saying it." Shrinate added, "Poor Mr...Puri, you've been trolled by your own Home Minister Amit Shah."

371.title: Bilkis Bano rape convicts greeted with garlands at VHP office in Guj
371.article_body: The Vishwa Hindu Parishad (VHP) on Wednesday reportedly greeted convicts in the Bilkis Bano gangrape case with garlands at its office in Gujarat. Pictures of the garlanded convicts have emerged on social media. The 11 convicts, sentenced to life imprisonment, were released from jail in Gujarat on Monday. Their relatives touched their feet and offered them sweets after their release.

372.title: 2 UP policemen taken off duty for dancing in uniform on I-Day
372.article_body: Two Uttar Pradesh policemen were taken off duty for dancing in their uniform on Independence Day during the celebrations, an official said. Pilibhit Superintendent of Police Dinesh Kumar P, sent SI Saurabh Kumar and constable Anuj to police lines, after a video of the duo was shared. The SP has asked circle officer of the area to probe the matter.

373.title: Class 6 boy gets locked inside school toilet for 19 hrs, headmaster held
373.article_body: Police have arrested the headmaster of a school, after a class 6 student of a primary school in UP's Auraiya district was left locked in the school toilet for 19 hours on August 5. Police said the headmaster was arrested for keeping the incident under wraps and allegedly tried to bribe the family to not file a complaint.

374.title: 4 killed, 3 injured due to lightning in Andhra Pradesh's Eluru
374.article_body: Four labourers were killed due to a lightning strike in Andhra Pradesh's Eluru while they were working in the district reserve forest, police said. Three others were reportedly injured and shifted to the hospital. The deceased were identified as 35-year-old Kondababu, 20-year-old Dharmaraju, 25-year-old Raju and 18-year-old Venu, whose bodies were sent to Eluru hospital for postmortem.

375.title: Israel, Turkey to re-establish full diplomatic relations
375.article_body: Israel and Turkey will re-establish full diplomatic relations and exchange ambassadors, the Israeli Prime Minister's office said on Wednesday. The two countries, who were formerly close, had a falling-out in 2010 over the Israel-Palestine conflict. Israel's caretaker Prime Minister Yair Lapid said the resumption of relations will boost regional stability and business activity.

376.title: Ryan Giggs admits to lifelong infidelity, says his reputation as love cheat is justified
376.article_body: Ex-Manchester United footballer Ryan Giggs admitted to lifelong infidelity in court testimony and agreed his reputation as a "love cheat" is justified. On being asked if he was able to resist women if he was attracted to them, despite being in a relationship, he said, "No." Giggs is on trial after being accused of physically assaulting his ex-girlfriend Kate Greville.

377.title: US and China clash on Twitter over climate change
377.article_body: The US and China, the world's two biggest emitters of greenhouse gases, have clashed on Twitter on steps to mitigate climate change. Reacting to a new US climate law, China's Foreign Ministry on Tuesday tweeted, "Good to hear. But...can the US deliver?" In response, US Ambassador to China Nicholas Burns wrote, "You can bet America will meet our commitments."

378.title: NASA's Lucy mission spots Trojan asteroid around Jupiter with its own moon
378.article_body: NASA's Lucy mission has discovered that Polymele, one of the Trojan asteroids around Jupiter, has its own moon. The satellite, which is reported to be roughly 200 km away from Polymele, is 5 km in diameter. The asteroid itself is reportedly 27 km in diameter. The moon has, however, not been named as astronomers are yet to define its characteristics.

379.title: Sometimes even in a room full of people who love me, I have felt alone: Virat Kohli
379.article_body: Ex-India captain Virat Kohli, while talking about mental health in a recent interview, said, "I personally have experienced times when even in a room full of people who support and love me, I felt alone." He stated, "It is crucial to consistently keep in touch with your inner self." He further emphasised on importance of "reconnecting with core self".

380.title: Want to study Kejriwal government's education model: Bihar Minister
380.article_body: Bihar Education Minister Chandrashekhar on Wednesday said his government will send a team to Delhi and other states to study their education models. "I...feel that the existing school education system in the state must be changed. It needs a complete overhaul," Chandrashekhar said. "I have started interacting with government teachers and officials of the department," he added.

381.title: Sub-inspector dies of electrocution while washing vehicle in Nagpur
381.article_body:
A 54-year-old police sub-inspector, identified as Sahebrao Bahale, died of electrocution while washing an official vehicle using electric pump at the police headquarters in Maharashtra's Nagpur on Wednesday, an official said. Bahale was working as a driver with the local crime branch unit.
Prima facie, the electric current passed in the water, the official added.

382.title: Jaishankar shares incident from US visit when he was asked for COVID vaccine certificate
382.article_body: A video shows External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar sharing an incident from the time he and his son visited a US restaurant in 2021. "They wanted to see our COVID-19 vaccine certificate...I showed them my phone while my son produced a folded paper," Jaishankar said. "I...said 'Okay, this is where they are'," Jaishankar added while praising the CoWIN platform.

383.title: Maharashtra sees 1,800 new COVID-19 cases, a rise of more than double in 1 day
383.article_body: Maharashtra reported 1,800 fresh COVID-19 cases on Wednesday, a huge jump from the 836 cases reported the previous day. Mumbai alone reported 975 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours. Six more people, including two in Mumbai, succumbed to the infection in the state and the active cases stood at 11,370.

384.title: When I came to run for Sachin, Afridi was abusing him a lot: Sehwag on 2003 WC match
384.article_body: Recalling the 2003 World Cup match against Pakistan, former India opener Virender Sehwag said, "When I came to run for Sachin Tendulkar...Shahid Afridi was abusing him a lot, kept saying something or the other." Sehwag added, "But he remained focussed. He knew it was important for him to stay at the crease." Sachin scored 98(75) in the match.

385.title: Will benefit millions: UNICEF as it secures 1st malaria vaccine supply
385.article_body: UNICEF has awarded a contract to GSK, a pharmaceutical firm, for the first-ever supply of malaria vaccine with a value of up to $170 million. This grant will make 18 million doses of RTS,S available for next three years, potentially saving thousands of lives each year, UNICEF stated. The vaccine is a result of 35 years of research, it added.

386.title: Indian boxer Vijender Singh knocks out Ghana's Eliasu Sulley in 'The Jungle Rumble'
386.article_body: India's 2008 Olympics bronze medal-winning boxer Vijender Singh on Wednesday knocked out Ghana's Eliasu Sulley in the super middleweight main card in 'The Jungle Rumble' to register his 13th victory in pro boxing. Vijender knocked out the Ghanaian boxer in the second round. Vijender has now won nine of his pro boxing bouts by knocking out the opponent.

387.title: Jacqueline shares note as ED names her as accused in ₹200 crore extortion case
387.article_body: Jacqueline Fernandez shared a note on Instagram on Wednesday as the ED named her as an accused in the ₹200 crore extortion case involving Sukesh Chandrasekhar. "Dear me, I deserve all good things, I am powerful, I accept myself, it will all be okay. I am strong, I will achieve my goals and dreams, I can do it," it read.

388.title: Grenade launcher-equipped robot dog unveiled at Russian arms expo: Report
388.article_body: A robot dog, equipped with a rocket-propelled grenade launcher, was unveiled at Russia's Army 2022 expo on Monday, according to a video shared by news agency RIA Novosti. The dog is reportedly capable of shooting, transporting weapons and delivering medicines, supplies to front-line soldiers. The dog's frame, however, resembled that of Chinese manufacturer Unitree Robotics' consumer-grade robot.

389.title: PM, Union ministers attend screening of Doordarshan serial 'Swaraj'
389.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Wednesday attended the special screening of the Doordarshan-produced serial 'Swaraj: Bharat Ke Swatantrata Sangram Ki Samagra Gatha' at the Balayogi Auditorium in Parliament Library Building. He was accompanied by BJP National President JP Nadda and Union ministers. It is a 75-episode serial on the freedom struggle.

390.title: Family driver among 4 held for kidnapping, raping 17-yr-old in Goa
390.article_body: A 17-year-old girl was allegedly kidnapped and raped multiple times in Goa and police have arrested the family driver, along with three other men, an official said on Wednesday. "After the disappearance of the girl, her mother filed a missing person's report," said Vasco police inspector Kapil Nayak. I was raped on several occasions, the girl said in her statement.

391.title: People would come outside house to take blessings: Swwapnil on playing Krishna
391.article_body: Actor Swwapnil Joshi, who played the titular role in Ramanand Sagar's 'Shri Krishna' at the age of 15, revealed that people would gather outside his house just to catch a glimpse of him and take blessings. "I feel overwhelmed and delighted to see how people still see me as a medium between them and the divine incarnation," he added.

392.title: Ajmer-Delhi Jan Shatabdi to get extra coaches due to more rush
392.article_body: One new coach each will be added to First Class AC chair and Second Class AC chair in Ajmer-Delhi Sarai Rohilla Jan Shatabdi. The extra coaches will run from August 19 to November 30 in view of a long waiting list of railway passengers. The train leaves Ajmer Junction at 5:40 am and arrives at Delhi station at 11:35 am.

393.title: India purchasing Russian oil that has Ukrainian blood in it: Ukraine
393.article_body: Ukraine's Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba on Wednesday said that every barrel of crude oil that India is buying from Russia at a discount has Ukrainian blood in it. Ukraine expected a "stronger practical support" from India amid the Russia-Ukraine war, he added. On Russian oil's purchase, Indian External Affairs Minister Jaishankar earlier said, "It's my…duty to…get [people] the best deal."

394.title: He's going to be here for a long time: Anupam Kher on Kartik Aaryan
394.article_body: Actor Anupam Kher recently shared a picture of himself with Kartik Aaryan. He called himself and Kartik as the "superstars" of the year because of the success of their respective films, 'The Kashmir Files' and 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2'. Anupam added that Kartik is going to be in the industry for a long time as "an actor and a superstar".

395.title: SL ex-Prez Rajapaksa to return to the country next week: Cousin
395.article_body: Former Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa will return to the country on August 24, his cousin Udayanga Weeratunga said on Wednesday. Rajapaksa, who fled Sri Lanka in July amid an anti-government public agitation, is presently staying in Thailand. "He talked to me on the phone, I can tell you he will return to the country next week," said Weeratunga.

396.title: Actress Gong Hyo-Jin to marry singer Kevin Oh in October: Reports
396.article_body: Korean actress Gong Hyo-jin and Korean-American singer Kevin Oh will get married in October. Gong's agency Management SOOP confirmed the news on Wednesday. "They will be holding their wedding privately in October with only their close relatives and acquaintances present," the statement read. Gong Hyo-jin and Kevin Oh confirmed their relationship in April.

397.title: Railway Minister shares video of India's 3.5-km-long train with 6 locos and 295 wagons
397.article_body: Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw took to Twitter to share a video of 3.50km-long Super Vasuki loaded train, billed as the heaviest and longest freight train with six locos and 295 loaded wagons. South East Central Railway operated the train on August 15 as part of the 'Azadi ka Amrit Mahotsav' celebrations. It was run from Korba in Chhattisgarh to Rajnandgaon.

398.title: Don't make me the mother of 30 & 40-year-olds: Shefali Shah to filmmakers
398.article_body: Actress Shefali Shah, who recently portrayed the role of Alia Bhatt's mother in 'Darlings', has requested the filmmakers not to approach her with the role of a mother. "Don't come to me with stuff because you've run out of imagination of who to cast as a mother," she said. "Don't make me the mother of...40...and...30-year-old because I'm not," Shefali added.

399.title: Man shares how TTE helped him while travelling with baby, Railway Ministry replies
399.article_body: A man has shared how a travelling ticket examiner (TTE) shifted him to a well-lit seat as he was travelling with a baby. "Travelling with a 1y old baby on train 12601 (B1 Coach) boarding at Kannur, the TTE...[gave]...us his well-lit seat," he wrote. "We hope...you and the toddler had a comfortable journey...We're always at your service," Railway Ministry replied.

400.title: CBI freezes ₹16.97 crore FDs belonging to TMC leader Mondal, family
400.article_body: The CBI on Wednesday froze ₹16.97 crore worth of fixed deposits (FDs) belonging to Trinamool Congress (TMC) leader Anubrata Mondal and his family members. Meanwhile, CBI officers visited his residence in Bolpur to question his daughter on Wednesday. However, Sukanya Mondal refused to talk to them. Anubrata Mondal was arrested last Thursday in connection with a cross-border cattle smuggling case.

401.title: I don’t know why they are doing this: Anjali Arora on obscene video leak
401.article_body: Reacting to the obscene video being circulated in her name, Instagram influencer Anjali Arora said, "I don't know why they are doing this." Adding that the video first surfaced when she was still contesting in reality show 'Lock Upp', Anjali said her family had lodged complaints regarding the video. "Those who can't reach your level start defaming you," she said.

402.title: Raj Cong setting 'new records' in crimes against women, Dalits: Shekhawat
402.article_body: Union Minister Gajendra Singh Shekhawat on Wednesday criticised the Congress saying its government in Rajasthan was setting "new records" in crimes against women and atrocities against Dalits. Citing the National Crime Records Bureau data, Shekhawat said, "Today, Rajasthan is at number one in the cases of rape in the country, second in terms of trafficking of minor girls."
